Description: Rim sherd with turn to neck of East Greek (Late Wild Goat?) pottery krater; pale brown clay with much silver mica; glaze fired orange; exterior: evidence of cream slip and glaze decoration, painted dots on outer edge of rim: interior: cream slip; streaky brown painted band on neck; remains of painted meander running right on rim; inscription cut through meander.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1175)
